title: Stop using CC an as example of how to counter a champ.
body: CC counters every champ minus a select few. Saying, "lol Zed has no weakness but he has counterplay cuz CC" or "just CC kalista" is not a reliable counterplay argument. When something counters just about every single champion, it is not counterplay.

replies.body:
Telling you to 'just CC the fucker' is telling you a form of countering a champion, it's just not as well worded as it should be.

Like if someone said "Just CC Kat," well if your team wasn't in range to follow up, what did you just do? Annoy her.

Now, if someone tells you "Just CC Kat when she ults, this stops most if her damage, and now she's in the middle of your team," now you've been told how to play against her.

Same thing for Zed. CCing during his ult. Depending on the length, it removes most of the damage he could cause and let's you walk/limp away.

For Kalista, it'd be more "She has a really exploitable early game. She cannot cancel her AA, and as a result will stand still for about a good deal of time. As such, you needs to poke/AA/initate when she does this. One or two early punishes will cause most bad Kalistas to back off, delaying her annoying late game. Targeted CC also helps loads."

So yes, CC is a counter to every champion, but it is a reliable argument when you tell people how and when to do it, not just to do it.

I'm not dismissing that CC is effective. It doesn't matter if you CC Zed or Teemo, it's still giving you a window to attack them without retaliation. What I'm arguing is that if CC is the only counterplay a champion has, they are better off than every other champion in the game, because they have some of the lowest amounts of counterplay in the game.

Its not about just the CC, its about how much the CC affects them. Stun a Cho'gath, or a Gragas, Or a Nautilus, or a Sion. They're not going to care too much. Now stun a Vayne, or a Yasuo, or a Yi, or a Fiora, and suddenly, they've been crippled. All (ok most) champions are effective against CC. But CC does affect some champions more than it does others.

> [{quoted}](name=Nucleophilic atk,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=AbdNLc3N,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-03-10T20:46:13.153+0000)

That's not really true though.  CC *affects* every champ minus a select few (assuming you're referring to things like {{champion:2}} {{champion:11}} ), but it only really *counters* the ones who will be dead by the time CC wears off -- i.e., squishies, and especially squishy divers (who will probably be in the middle of the enemy team when they get CC'd).

Tanks can just take the CC, soak up damage, and go back to what they were doing (and usually 35% faster, too), so it doesn't counter them to nearly the same degree.  Long range pokers are hard to hit with most CC in the first place, and if you do, you still have to go through their entire team to follow up on them, they don't come to you like Zed.

And then there's the champs that are *really* countered by CC because they rely on interruptible channels, like {{champion:55}} ...
